FuncDef:
The lsp-loopback autoclear command sets a timeout period, after which loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP is automatically disabled.
The undo lsp-loopback autoclear command restores the default timeout period.
By default, the timeout period is 5 minutes.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a timeout period, after which loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP is automatically disabled.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 2880, in minutes. By default, the value is 5.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the lsp-loopback start command is run to enable loopback detection on a transit node of a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP, loopback detection is automatically disabled after 5 minutes by default. To set a timeout period after which loopback detection for a static bidirectional co-routed CR-LSP is automatically disabled, run the lsp-loopback autoclear command.
Prerequisites
MPLS TE has been enabled using the mpls te command.
